# Arpeggio: Major 7th in C# (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is when the notes of a chord are played one after the other instead of simultaneously. In this case, we are looking at a Major 7th arpeggio in the key of C#. 

## Notes and Intervals:
The C# Major 7th arpeggio consists of the following notes:

- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- B# (Major 7th)

The intervals between these notes are as follows:
- Root to Major 3rd: Major 3rd (4 semitones)
- Major 3rd to Perfect 5th: Perfect 5th (3 semitones)
- Perfect 5th to Major 7th: Major 7th (4 semitones)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The Major 7th arpeggio in C# is often used in jazz, R&B, and soul music. It carries a smooth and jazzy flavor, adding sophistication and color to harmonies and melodies. The Major 7th chord is known for its lush and dreamy sound, creating a sense of warmth and richness in the music.
